answers.author: Mindy Manson
answers.text:
I have attached the Section from our Comprehensive Plan that deals with redevelopment.  We are generally handling this with overlay zoning which respects the existing land use but provides for alternative redevelopment in the core, older areas of our City.  For the Downtown Historic Overlay and our South Ballard Overlay, there are also specific ordinances included within our Zoning Ordinance that speak to architectural control, parking , etc. that I would be happy to provide.

answers.author: Katie Wilken
answers.text:
San Diego won the national planning award a few years ago and they came up with a very generalized land use plan that allowed for some more detailed character area/neighborhood plans. http://www.sandiego.gov/planning/genplan/#genplan
Chandler, AZ is a suburban community approaching build-out http://www.chandleraz.gov/default.aspx?pageid=121
Tehachapi, CA has a general plant that focuses on form and ensuring that infill fits into existing form. http://www.liveuptehachapi.com/index.aspx?nid=259
Denver, CO also has a good one that has a lot about fitting into existing development. http://www.denvergov.org/planning/BlueprintDenver/tabid/431883/Default.aspx

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
A member is about to embark on a Comp Plan update and as part of that process, is looking for successful infill or redevelopment projects from typical suburban zoning to higher density/mixed use development.  They are specifically looking for suburban areas, leaning more toward infill and redevelopment and less large-scale, new development.  Please send any good examples of land-use overhaul my way. 
Thanks,
Greg Stopka, Central Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
title: Land Use Overhaul
